t: Isaiah 21
God Commands That Babylon Be Taken
The*p oracle concerning the wilderness of the sea. As*pn windstorms in the Negev sweep on, It*ln comes from the wilderness, from a terrifying land.

A*ln harsh vision has been shown to me; The*ln treacherous one still*i deals treacherously, and the destroyer still*i destroys. Go*ln up, Elam, lay siege, Media; I*ln have made an end of all the groaning she has caused.
For*ln this reason my loins are full of anguish; Pains*ln have seized me like the pains of a woman in labor. I*ln am so bewildered I cannot hear, so terrified I cannot see.
My*ln mind reels, horror overwhelms me; The*ln twilight I longed for has been turned for me into trembling.
They*ln set the table, they spread out the cloth, they eat, they drink; “Rise*ln up, captains, oil the shields,”
For*p thus the Lord says to me, “Go,*pn station the lookout, let him report what he sees.
When*ln he sees riders, horsemen in pairs, A*ln train of donkeys, a train of camels, Let*ln him pay close attention, very close attention.”
Then*p the lookout called, “O*pn Lord, I stand continually by day on the watchtower, And*ln I am stationed every night at my guard post.
Now*ln behold, here comes a troop of riders, horsemen in pairs.” And*ln one said, “Fallen, fallen is Babylon; And*ln all the images of her gods are shattered on the ground.”
O*ln my threshed people,*i and my afflicted of the threshing floor! What*ln I have heard from the Lord*s of hosts, The*ln God of Israel, I make known to you.
Oracles about Edom and Arabia
The*p oracle concerning Edom. One*pn keeps calling to me from Seir, “Watchman,*ln how far gone is the night? Watchman,*ln how far gone is the night?”
The*ln watchman says, “Morning*ln comes but also night. If*ln you would inquire, inquire; Come*ln back again.”
The*p oracle about Arabia. In*pn the thickets of Arabia you must spend the night, O*ln caravans of Dedanites.
Bring*ln water for the thirsty, O*ln inhabitants of the land of Tema, Meet*ln the fugitive with bread.
For*ln they have fled from the swords, From*ln the drawn sword, and from the bent bow And*ln from the press of battle.
For*p thus the Lord said to me, “In a year, as a hired man would count it, all the splendor of Kedar will terminate;
and the remainder of the number of bowmen, the mighty men of the sons of Kedar, will be few; for the Lord*s God of Israel has spoken.”
